targetUsers.name: Casual Flight Simulation Enthusiast
targetUsers.description: A gamer interested in flight simulation experiences who wants to explore real-world locations from the air with intuitive controls and realistic visuals
painPoints: Existing flight simulators are too complex or too unrealistic
Want to fly over familiar real-world locations with accurate terrain and buildings
Existing browser-based solutions have poor performance
Limited sense of speed and maneuverability in many games

coreProblems.title: Lack of accessible 3D flight experience over real-world terrain
coreProblems.description: Most flight simulators are either too complex for casual users or use low-quality procedural terrain. There's a gap in the market for an accessible flight game that combines realistic real-world terrain and buildings with intuitive controls and strong sense of speed.

coreProblems.title: Performance limitations of browser-based 3D geospatial applications
coreProblems.description: Browser-based 3D mapping applications (like Cesium.js) struggle with performance when rendering large amounts of 3D tiles and terrain data, limiting the potential for smooth flight simulation experiences.

scenarios.title: Player explores city from the air
scenarios.description: A player starts the game, loads a scene with real-world terrain (e.g., their home city), and flies an aircraft over familiar landmarks, buildings, and terrain features with smooth controls and realistic physics.

scenarios.title: Player navigates using flight instruments
scenarios.description: While flying, the player uses the HUD to monitor speed, altitude, and heading to navigate to points of interest or complete objectives.

scenarios.title: Player completes mission by reaching waypoints
scenarios.description: The player accepts a mission with defined waypoints, flies the aircraft to each waypoint in sequence, and completes the mission to earn points or unlock new content.
